Full job description
About Us

Overview
Georgia Tech prides itself on its technological resources, collaborations, high-quality student body, and its commitment to building an outstanding and diverse community of learning, discovery, and creation. We strongly encourage applicants whose values align with our institutional values, as outlined in our Strategic Plan. These values include academic excellence, diversity of thought and experience, inquiry and innovation, collaboration and community, and ethical behavior and stewardship. Georgia Tech has policies to promote a healthy work-life balance and is aware that attracting faculty may require meeting the needs of two careers.

About Georgia Tech
Georgia Tech is a top-ranked public research university situated in the heart of Atlanta, a diverse and vibrant city with numerous economic and cultural strengths. The Institute serves more than 45,000 students through top-ranked undergraduate, graduate, and executive programs in engineering, computing, science, business, design, and liberal arts. Georgia Tech's faculty attracted more than $1.4 billion in research awards this past year in fields ranging from biomedical technology to artificial intelligence, energy, sustainability, semiconductors, neuroscience, and national security. Georgia Tech ranks among the nation's top 20 universities for research and development spending and No. 1 among institutions without a medical school.
Georgia Tech's Mission and Values
Georgia Tech's mission is to develop leaders who advance technology and improve the human condition. The Institute has nine key values that are foundational to everything we do:
1. Students are our top priority.
2. We strive for excellence.
3. We thrive on diversity.
4. We celebrate collaboration.
5. We champion innovation.
6. We safeguard freedom of inquiry and expression.
7. We nurture the wellbeing of our community.
8. We act ethically.
9. We are responsible stewards.

Over the next decade, Georgia Tech will become an example of inclusive innovation, a leading technological research university of unmatched scale, relentlessly committed to serving the public good; breaking new ground in addressing the biggest local, national, and global challenges and opportunities of our time; making technology broadly accessible; and developing exceptional, principled leaders from all backgrounds ready to produce novel ideas and create solutions with real human impact.
About the College of Computing at the Georgia Institute of Technology
The College of Computing has been a leader in defining modern computing as a paradigm that combines the foundations of theoretical mathematics and information science, the force of invention in computational systems and processes, and interdisciplinary practice that integrates innovation in computing with all facets of life. Today, the college comprises five schools that offer unique academic programs and conduct research specifically related to their concentration areas: Computer Science, Computing Instruction, Cybersecurity and Privacy, Interactive Computing, and Computational Science and Engineering.
Location

Atlanta, GA
Job Summary

Job Responsibilities include:
Plans, organizes, and coordinates college-wide ongoing academic assessment programs, projects, and activities measuring student learning.
Supports faculty with the advancement of academic assessment and improvement of student learning through effective outreach efforts.
Works to develop assessment plans to monitor progress towards program learning objectives and goals. Coordinates academic assessment activities for compliance SACSCOC standards related to assessment and educational effectiveness and assists with other specialized accredited bodies.
Collects and reviews program accreditation/review assessment data to assist programs/schools in implementing findings for continuous improvement and identification of opportunities to expand student learning opportunities.
Reviews and provides feedback to programs on assessment plans and progress.
Provides assessment information to the school leadership to assist with college decision-making as relates to strategic planning.
Works with the Institute's Office of Academic Effectiveness in preparing reports on the quality of institutional assessment efforts.
Performing quantitative and/or qualitative analysis of assessment and institutional related data
Assist to create and maintain assessment website for the college.
This is a hybrid working position.
Required Qualifications

This position vacancy is an open rank announcement. Final job offer will be dependent on candidate qualifications in alignment with Research Faculty ranks as outlined in section 3.2.1 of the Georgia Tech Faculty Handbook (https://www.policylibrary.gatech.edu/faculty-handbook/3.2.1-research-faculty-hiring-and-promotion-guidelines)
Research Associate I
Bachelor's degree
Research Associate II
A Master's degree and three (3) years of relevant full-time experience after completion of that degree, or
A Master's degree and five (5) years of relevant full-time experience after completion of a Bachelor's degree, or
A Doctoral degree.
Preferred Qualifications
Master's Degree
3 to 5 years of experience with a programming language (SQL, Python, etc), statistical software (SPSS, STATA, SAS), and experience in research design and program evaluation methodologies.
Required Documents to Attach

Availability to work flexible hours including evenings, weekends, and overtime in order to provide escalation support for our 24/7 Help Desk service agreements.
Analyze, design, program, debug, commission, support and service automation software systems according to specifications and customer requirements as well as provide software solutions for our customers through system troubleshooting and diagnostics.
Develop, test and deploy after sales software features for existing customers under the guidance of a Software Support Lead; assist with/support the development of software for current and upcoming projects.

Full job description
About Fluence: Fluence Energy, Inc. (Nasdaq: FLNC) is a global market leader in energy storage products and services, and optimization software for renewables and storage. With a presence in over 47 markets globally, Fluence provides an ecosystem of offerings to drive the clean energy transition, including modular, scalable energy storage products, comprehensive service offerings, and the Fluence IQ Platform, which delivers AI-enabled SaaS products for managing and optimizing renewables and storage from any provider. Fluence is transforming the way we power our world by helping customers create more resilient and sustainable electric grids.
For more information, visit our website, or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. To stay up to date on the latest industry insights, sign up for Fluence's Full Potential Blog.
OUR CULTURE AND VALUES

We are guided by our passion to transform the way we power our world. Achieving our goals requires creativity, diversity of ideas and backgrounds, and building trust to effect change and move with speed.

We are Leading
Fluence currently has thousands of MW of energy storage projects operated or awarded worldwide in addition to the thousands of MW of projects managed by our trading platform—and we are growing every day.

We are Responsible
Fluence is defined by its unwavering commitment to safety, quality, and integrity.

We are Agile
We achieve our goals and meet our customer’s needs by cultivating curiosity, adaptability, and self-reflection in our teams.

We are Fun
We value the diversity in thought and experience of our coworkers and customers. Through honest, forthcoming, and respectful communications we work to ensure that Fluence is an inclusive and welcoming environment for all.

We are looking for a Performance Engineer/Analyst our join our Performance Engineering team - Americas Region who will serve as an expert for technical and engineering matters related to overall performance of battery storage systems during Execution and Operation phases of a project. As a Performance Engineer/Analyst, an successful candidate will be able to identify the requirements, investigate the issues, create scripts and perform data analysis to provide resolutions. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise as well as a critical thinking ability.
What does a Performance Engineer/Performance Analyst do at Fluence?
Creating DC and AC Analysis scripts using Python and dealing with large data sets and data frames
Create data points list and perform data acquisition
Perform BESS DC and AC data analysis using various analytical tools
Review customer contractual requirements and create project test plans
Evaluate the site performance in accordance with contractual commitments for all customer projects during execution and operation phase and create Project test reports
Basic understanding of Single Line Diagram
Plan, Schedule, Coordinate, and work efficiently to complete projects in timely manner
Collaborate cross functionally with multiple teams – Battery, Sales, Operations & Execution, Services, Product to determine possible improvements based on performance results including the identification of needs, design improvements, testing etc.
Ability to perform root cause analysis, troubleshooting and provide recommendations for improving performance at sites
What does the ideal candidate look like?
BS in Electrical Engineering with Computer Science Background. Master’s is a plus.
2-3 years of work experience with an Energy Storage Company
Proven records of creating python scripts
Ability to create algorithm and create codes from scratch
Familiarity with API and data structures & data frames
Familiarity and understanding of AWS – S3, Sagemaker
Familiarity with Jupyter notebook
Strong background in using MS Office software: Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Good Understanding about Jira, Confluence
Willing to work overtime and with tight deadlines
Good Multi-tasking and Time-Management skills
Fluence IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or familial status.

GTRI’s Cooperative Education (“co-op”) program offers you extensive opportunities to participate in diverse scientific and technological endeavors, use state-of-the-art equipment and rapidly improve your technical and leadership skills. The program allows you to alternate three semesters of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school.
The Applied Systems Laboratory (ASL) seeks co-ops in the Systems Integration (SID) and Tools and Test Division (PMQT) for the Fall 2024 semester. The student will work under the guidance of GTRI researchers performing one or more of the following activities:
Embedded Software Development
Windows Software Programming
Data Analysis
Python Programming
Test Automation
Software Test and Verification
Systems Engineering

Co-op

Must be able to complete at least three full-time co-op terms (alternating three terms of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school) prior to graduation

Ability to obtain a Secret Clearance.
Experience with one more programming language.
Experience with Python.

Strong math skills and ability to learn complex engineering concepts

40 hours per week

UNITED STATES, GEORGIA, ATLANTA

INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY

11-APR-2024

HOW YOU'LL HELP US KEEP CLIMBING (OVERVIEW & KEY RESPONSIBILITIES)


Delta Air Lines, Inc. has multiple openings for Senior Full Stack Software Development Engineers in Atlanta, GA. Design, prototype, and demonstrate new software features and components of front-end and back-end to users to ensure compliance with requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist in the design, implementation, and optimization of related approaches, tools, and workflows.
Collaborate with the technical teams, business teams, and product managers to ensure that the code that is developed meets their vision.
Design software solutions to meet functional and technical requirements.
Align with security/compliance frameworks and controls requirements.
Own quality posture and write automated tests, ideally before writing code.
Write codes and develop delivery pipelines and automated deployment scripts.
Configure software services, such as databases and monitoring.
Implement Service Reliability Engineering.
Fix software problems from the development phase through the production phase, which requires being on call for production support.
Telecommuting permitted up to two days per week.

BENEFITS AND PERKS TO HELP YOU KEEP CLIMBING
Our culture is rooted in a shared dedication to living our values – Care, Integrity, Resilience, Servant Leadership, and Teamwork – every day, in everything we do. At Delta, our people are our success. At the heart of what we offer is our focus on Sharing Success with Delta employees. Exploring a career at Delta gives you a chance to see the world while earning great compensation and benefits to help you keep climbing along the way.

Why You'll Love Delta
Competitive salary, industry-leading proﬁt sharing program, and performance incentives
401(k) with generous company contributions up to 9%
Paid time off including vacation, holidays, paid personal time, maternity and parental leave
Comprehensive health beneﬁts including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability and life beneﬁts
Family care assistance through fertility support, surrogacy and adoption assistance, lactation support, subsidized back-up care, and programs that help with loved ones in all stages
Holistic Wellbeing programs to support physical, emotional, social, and financial health, including access to an employee assistance program offering support for you and anyone in your household, free financial coaching, and extensive resources supporting mental health
Domestic and International space-available flight privileges for employees and eligible family members
World-wide partnerships to engage in community service and innovative goals created to focus on sustainability and reducing our carbon footprint
Recognition rewards and awards through the platform Unstoppable Together
Business Resource Groups created to connect employees with common interests to promote inclusion, provide perspective and help implement strategies
Access to over 500 discounts, specialty savings and voluntary benefits through Deltaperks such as car and hotel rentals and auto, home, and pet insurance, legal services, and childcare
WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED (MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS)
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related, and seven years of experience in software development or related.
In the alternative, will accept a Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related, and six years of experience in software development or related
Cloud-native development, RESTful APIs, and microservices with Springboot;
API Management Platform including AWS API Gateway or Apigee API Management Platform;
Agile methodologies, DevSecOps, CI/CD pipeline, and Build tools including GIT, Jenkins, Maven, and Gradle;
Java/J2EE framework, design patterns and tools, and Oracle relational database; and
Web application frameworks with responsive design and API technologies including jQuery, AngularJS, Swagger, and Spring boot within the airline industry and customer facing portals.

Airline Industry Preferred

Who We Are
KEH
We are the original camera re-commerce company, always envisioning a better way to support the passion and profession of photography. Serving the camera community since 1979, we have become the largest curated market for field-tested, expert-graded photo and video equipment in the industry.
As a Security and Compliance Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in safeguarding our organization's digital assets and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards. You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining security measures to protect our systems, networks, and data from cyber threats and vulnerabilities. Additionally, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and enforce compliance with industry regulations, such as GDPR, CCPA, PCI DSS, and others.

Job Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and enforce security policies, procedures, and controls to safeguard payment, personally identifiable information (PII), and employee data across e-commerce and physical retail platforms.
Conduct regular risk assessments and security audits to identify vulnerabilities, assess risks, and recommend and implement mitigating controls.
Design, implement, and maintain physical network security measures to protect against unauthorized access, intrusion, and data breaches in both online and brick-and-mortar environments.
Manage and maintain compliance with industry standards and regulations such as PCI DSS, GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant data protection laws and frameworks.
Collaborate cross-functionally with IT, engineering, legal, and other teams to ensure security and compliance requirements are integrated into business processes and systems.
Stay abreast of emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and regulatory changes in the security and privacy landscape, and proactively recommend and implement appropriate measures to mitigate risks.
Provide guidance and support to internal stakeholders on security best practices, compliance requirements, and incident response procedures.
Lead or participate in security incident response activities, including investigation, containment, remediation, and reporting.
Develop and deliver security awareness training programs to educate employees on security risks, policies, and procedures.

Full job description
Description
Summary of This Role
The Fraud Client Consultant serves as the primary subject matter expert (SME) supporting client consultancy and sales efforts of our Fraud products and services. This position is responsible for actively supporting the Prospect Analysis, Presentation and Closing stages of the sales process, working in conjunction with the sales team as the key advisor and product advocate. The Consultant will align clients needs and goals with the TSYS suite of Fraud products to deliver differentiated customer value with the role comprising:
Expert product and industry knowledge
Understanding of clients’ goals and business needs
Grow - Support the success & growth in sales
Consult - Trusted advisor to the customer defining solutions to business problems
Being part of a high caliber team supporting growth
What Part Will You Play?
Works with the client to gain an understanding of vision, portfolio performance, goals, and challenges.
Provides recommendations on strategies that result in effective fraud mitigation, improved profitability, and reduced risk.
Uses strategic thinking skills to contribute to development of client objectives to achieve goals in creative and effective ways.
Provides data-centric consultation to align client objectives into innovative solutions with TSYS Fraud & Risk products that provide value to the client and their cardholders.
Develops business cases, use cases and case studies to facilitate client conversations using data-driven methodologies.
Conducts product demos and presentations and assists product with go-to-market packaging.
Passionate about applying data and analytics to card issuer portfolio data.
Develops relationships with client counterparts through consulting engagements.
What Are We Looking For in This Role?
Experience:
6+ years relevant experience and/or working knowledge of the issuing and payment card business from both a card issuer perspective as well as a general understanding from the technology and processing side of the business
Consulting or professional services experience
Education: Bachelor's Degree - Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS, Business or equivalent work experience, such as relevant technical background and/or work product/SME knowledge in lieu of a degree.
What Are Our Desired Skills and Capabilities?
Knowledgeable of the credit card customer lifecycle with expertise in Fraud & Risk management.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and recommendations to teams and business stakeholders.
General knowledge of web technology, data structures, and data visualization.
Data analysis and visualization skills to bring business cases and opportunities to life for a client.
Ability to multitask, juggling multiple clients/projects and initiatives, strong prioritization and follow up skills. Prioritizes most urgent work.
Applies proven solutions to client problems.
Ability to present and facilitate training in front of large audiences

Full job description
About Fluence: Fluence Energy, Inc. (Nasdaq: FLNC) is a global market leader in energy storage products and services, and optimization software for renewables and storage. With a presence in over 47 markets globally, Fluence provides an ecosystem of offerings to drive the clean energy transition, including modular, scalable energy storage products, comprehensive service offerings, and the Fluence IQ Platform, which delivers AI-enabled SaaS products for managing and optimizing renewables and storage from any provider. Fluence is transforming the way we power our world by helping customers create more resilient and sustainable electric grids.
For more information, visit our website, or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter. To stay up to date on the latest industry insights, sign up for Fluence's Full Potential Blog.
OUR CULTURE AND VALUES

We are guided by our passion to transform the way we power our world. Achieving our goals requires creativity, diversity of ideas and backgrounds, and building trust to effect change and move with speed.

We are Leading
Fluence currently has thousands of MW of energy storage projects operated or awarded worldwide in addition to the thousands of MW of projects managed by our trading platform—and we are growing every day.

We are Responsible
Fluence is defined by its unwavering commitment to safety, quality, and integrity.

We are Agile
We achieve our goals and meet our customer’s needs by cultivating curiosity, adaptability, and self-reflection in our teams.

We are Fun
We value the diversity in thought and experience of our coworkers and customers. Through honest, forthcoming, and respectful communications we work to ensure that Fluence is an inclusive and welcoming environment for all.

We are looking for a Performance Engineer/Analyst our join our Performance Engineering team - Americas Region who will serve as an expert for technical and engineering matters related to overall performance of battery storage systems during Execution and Operation phases of a project. As a Performance Engineer/Analyst, an successful candidate will be able to identify the requirements, investigate the issues, create scripts and perform data analysis to provide resolutions. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise as well as a critical thinking ability.
What does a Performance Engineer/Performance Analyst do at Fluence?
Creating DC and AC Analysis scripts using Python and dealing with large data sets and data frames
Create data points list and perform data acquisition
Perform BESS DC and AC data analysis using various analytical tools
Review customer contractual requirements and create project test plans
Evaluate the site performance in accordance with contractual commitments for all customer projects during execution and operation phase and create Project test reports
Basic understanding of Single Line Diagram
Plan, Schedule, Coordinate, and work efficiently to complete projects in timely manner
Collaborate cross functionally with multiple teams – Battery, Sales, Operations & Execution, Services, Product to determine possible improvements based on performance results including the identification of needs, design improvements, testing etc.
Ability to perform root cause analysis, troubleshooting and provide recommendations for improving performance at sites
What does the ideal candidate look like?
BS in Electrical Engineering with Computer Science Background. Master’s is a plus.
2-3 years of work experience with an Energy Storage Company
Proven records of creating python scripts
Ability to create algorithm and create codes from scratch
Familiarity with API and data structures & data frames
Familiarity and understanding of AWS – S3, Sagemaker
Familiarity with Jupyter notebook
Strong background in using MS Office software: Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Good Understanding about Jira, Confluence
Willing to work overtime and with tight deadlines
Good Multi-tasking and Time-Management skills
Fluence IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or familial status.

Position Overview
The Manager of Information Technology Solutions is responsible for supporting sales reps across the company, through maintaining the IT infrastructure and ensuring end-user satisfaction. The Manager of Information Technology Solutions will work alongside the sales and IT leadership to understand and support needs for computer operations and production support, systems and database administration, network operations, telecommunications, PC/desktop support and customer service. The role ensures systems performance and service level requirements are met; provides in-depth technical expertise for both tactical and operational initiatives.

Essential Job Functions
Serve as the go to support desk helper for field sales reps to create IT solutions quickly and efficiently.
Setup and deploy custom IT equipment.
Develop solutions to sales related IT issues.
Provide on-boarding and training support for all users IT needs.
Create custom reports using conventional data methods.
Create custom solutions for software systems that will help sales reps in the field.
Set-up and run regional training events for IT equipment and infrastructure.
Travel up to 25% to offices across the country to meet with sales team and help establish new IT needs across the company.
Develop programs and apps that will help our sales team run a more efficient process.
Work with leadership to provide companywide solutions for IT needs.
Set deadlines based on customer commitments and business needs; ensure deadlines are met.
Implement and ensure compliance with IT Systems Management Processes (e.g., ITIL) and Quality programs
Maintain established service level commitments for services on all technology platforms, including process measurement as well as customer satisfaction measurement.
Ensure established system procedures, including user ID maintenance, system resource monitoring, system tuning, capacity planning, backup/restore and the appropriate transfer of test systems to production operations and quality assurance
Identify operational issues impacting service levels and streamline IT processes to provide real-time visibility into infrastructure performance
Ensure uniform configuration standards for all infrastructure components and application appropriate maintenance activities
Demonstrate a high level of service delivery and do whatever is necessary, without compromising the integrity of the infrastructure, to ensure customer satisfaction. Be cognizant of end user experience with using technologies. Strive for a balance of user friendly and secure environment
